00031 /// @file xed-agen.h 
00032 /// @author Mark Charney   <mark.charney@intel.com> 
00033 
00034 
00035 #ifndef _XED_AGEN_H_
00036 # define _XED_AGEN_H_
00037 #include "xed-decoded-inst.h"
00038 #include "xed-error-enum.h"
00039 
00040 
00041 /// A function for obtaining register values. 32b return values should be
00042 /// zero extended to 64b. The error value is set to nonzero if the callback
00043 /// experiences some sort of problem.  @ingroup AGEN
00044 typedef xed_uint64_t (*xed_register_callback_fn_t)(xed_reg_enum_t reg, void* context, xed_bool_t* error);
00045 
00046 /// A function for obtaining the segment base values. 32b return values
00047 /// should be zero extended zero extended to 64b. The error value is set to
00048 /// nonzero if the callback experiences some sort of problem. 
00049 /// @ingroup AGEN
00050 typedef xed_uint64_t (*xed_segment_base_callback_fn_t)(xed_reg_enum_t reg, void* context, xed_bool_t* error);
00051 
00052 
00053 /// Initialize the callback functions. Tell XED what to call when using
00054 /// #xed_agen. 
00055 /// @ingroup AGEN
00056 XED_DLL_EXPORT void xed_agen_register_callback(xed_register_callback_fn_t register_fn,
00057                                                xed_segment_base_callback_fn_t segment_fn);
00058 
00059 /// Using the registered callbacks, compute the memory address for a
00060 /// specified memop in a decoded instruction. memop_index can have the
00061 /// value 0 for XED_OPERAND_MEM0, XED_OPERAND_AGEN, or 1 for
00062 /// XED_OPERAND_MEM1. Any other value results in an error being
00063 /// returned. The context parameter which is passed to the registered
00064 /// callbacks can be used to identify which thread's state is being
00065 /// referenced.
00066 /// @ingroup AGEN
00067 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_error_enum_t xed_agen(xed_decoded_inst_t* xedd,
00068                                          unsigned int memop_index,
00069                                          void* context,
00070                                          xed_uint64_t* out_address);
00071 
00072 
00073 #endif
00074 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00077 //End:
